articles.title: Time to Take the State of JavaScript 2023
articles.description: The long standing State of JavaScript survey is back for another run at figuring out what the community is up to and what tools we‚Äôre using. The results are always illuminating and we‚Äôll share the tastiest parts once available.
articles.author: Devographics

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†The Unbearable Weight of Massive JavaScript
articles.description: An extensive talk looking at what can be achieved by simplifying web architecture, chiefly by using new or upcoming Web Platform APIs and getting back to building fast, maintainable, user-friendly frontends. Slidedeck.
articles.author: Ryan Townsend

articles.title: TypeScript 5.3 Released
articles.description: The latest edition of the type-enhanced JavaScript superset is here. The headline feature is full support for the import attributes proposal (as it currently stands, at stage 3 in TC39), but there are many enhancements around type narrowing, interactive inlay hints for types in editors, and more. Not the biggest update, but progress nonetheless.
articles.author: Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

articles.title: Vite 5.0 Released
articles.description: The Vite suite of frontend tooling may have started life in the Vue.js world, but is now used by projects aplenty including SvelteKit, Remix, and Astro. v5 now uses Rollup 4, removes many deprecated features, and requires Node 18+. There‚Äôs a migration guide to help with your v4 to v5 progression.
articles.author: Evan You and Contributors

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†4 Web Devs, 1 App Idea
articles.description: Salma Alam-Naylor, Scott Tolinski, and Eve Porcello join Jason Lengstorf to kick off a fun new series where several developers all implement the same type of app, show off how they went about it, and react to each other‚Äôs approaches. Svelte, Astro, and Next.js each make an appearance.
articles.author: Learn with Jason

articles.title: Promises Training
articles.description: Practice working with promises through a curated collection of interactive challenges. Aimed at developers with at least an intermediate understanding of promises who want to dig deeper.
articles.author: Henrique Inonhe

articles.title: An Attempted Taxonomy of Web Components
articles.description: A collection of open-source web components (and lessons learned from using them) that may help you on your journey in this complex, developing space.
articles.author: Zach Leatherman

articles.title: Using OpenAI APIs to Analyze Automated Test Failures
articles.description: A look at how to develop a Nightwatch.js plugin which sends the test failure and associated errors to a service that integrates with OpenAI‚Äôs platform to analyze said errors and provide actionable feedback.
articles.author: Andrei Rusu

articles.title: Bruno: An Open-Source HTTP API Exploration App
articles.description: There are a lot of ‚ÄòAPI client‚Äô tools like this, commercial and non-commercial, with varying levels of features, but this is an open source one entirely built in JavaScript with a fully-offline ethos some might appreciate. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Anoop M D, Anusree P S and Contributors

articles.title: debounce 2.0: Delay Function Calls Until a Set Time Elapses
articles.description: If you don‚Äôt want something to run too often, debouncing is the strategy for you and this library makes it simple. v2 adds types and brings the code up to modern standards.
articles.author: Sindre Sorhus et al.

articles.title: H3: A Minimal HTTP Framework for Multiple JS Platforms
articles.description: Aims to be as universal as possible and works across numerous platforms, including Node, while offering the basic HTTP framework features and a compatibility layer with Express middleware. v1.9 just landed.
articles.author: UnJS

articles.title: request-animation-frames: Use requestAnimationFrame Anywhere
articles.description: The latest library from the one-man module powerhouse, Sindre Sorhus. The idea this time is to allow you to use requestAnimationFrame in any JavaScript environment. The implementation is delightfully simple.
articles.author: Sindre Sorhus

articles.title: Spectral.js: A More 'Paint-Like' Color Mixing Library
articles.description: If you have two colors to transition between, just tweening the RGB values can result in some rather ugly intermediate colors. Spectral.js uses Kubelka‚ÄìMunk theory which more closely matches how paints work for a visually satisfying result.
articles.author: Ronald van Wijnen

articles.title: 'A Node + TypeScript + ts-node + ESM Experience That Works'
articles.description: It‚Äôs just three files: package.json, tsconfig.json and a utilities file.
articles.author: Khalid Zoabi

articles.title: üñº medium-zoom 1.1: A Library for Medium-Style Image Zooming
articles.description: Responsive, can load a higher definition version of an image on zoom, and mouse, keyboard and gesture friendly. Now we just need a library that can cover up the bottom half of a page with junk like Medium also does now. Demo.
articles.author: Fran√ßois Chalifour

articles.description: The Node.js 20.x runtime is now available on AWS Lambda.
üéÅ A bumper list of dev-related tools & services running Black Friday deals.
GitHub looks at what's new in the latest Git release: Git 2.43.
The AWS Amplify team teases 'Gen 2' of their fullstack app platform.
‚≠êÔ∏è Transformers.js v2.9 ‚Äì State of the art ML in JavaScript. v2.9 adds support for depth estimation, zero-shot object detection, and optical document understanding.
Redux Toolkit 2.0 rc.0, Redux 5.0 rc.0, React-Redux 9.0 rc.0 ‚Äì Initial RCs with better packaging and smaller bundles. Final releases due soon.
Bun 1.0.14 ‚Äì Introduces a high-perf globbing API for matching files and strings.
Rspack 0.4 including Rsbuild 0.1 ‚Äì A fast Rust-based web bundler.
Node v21.2.0 (Current) and Node v20.10.0 (LTS)
Starlight 0.13.0 ‚Äì Beautiful docs sites atop Astro.

articles.title: An Interactive Guide to CSS Grid
articles.description: CSS Grid is a powerful and almost universally supported approach for building modern web layouts, but there‚Äôs still a learning curve involved. Josh shares his 'lightbulb moments', along with an outline of a mental model to adopt in order to best understand how CSS Grid works and how to use it effectively. Interactive demos too!
articles.author: Josh Comeau

articles.title: An Attempted Taxonomy of Web Components
articles.description: A collection of open-source web components (and lessons learned from using them) that may help you on your journey in this complex, developing space.
articles.author: Zach Leatherman

articles.title: CSS Nesting
articles.description: A good opportunity to brush up on all things native CSS nesting here, with practical examples and use cases.
articles.author: Ahmad Shadeed

articles.title: Getting Started with CSS Container Queries
articles.description: Fresh on MDN is a dive into the practicalities of building a layout with container queries ‚Äî a powerful new(ish!) tool in the CSS layout toolbox (and now supported by most browsers).
articles.author: Michelle Barker

articles.title: Your Site's URLs Can, and Should, Be Beautiful
articles.description: The key to making a 'beautiful' URL (which, to us, simply looks more useful) is in finding a balance between brevity and clarity.
articles.author: Jason Morehead

articles.title: Totally remdom (or How Browsers Zoom Text)
articles.description: A quick look at how various operating systems and browsers handle zooming text, and the importance of building a user interface that respects user preferences.
articles.author: Manuel Matuzoviƒá

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Cascade Layers, CSS Functions, and More CSS with Miriam¬†Suzanne
articles.description: Miriam joins Dave Rupert and Chris Coyier to talk about CSS updates and news on container queries, rolling out cascade layers, custom properties, exit animations, CSS functions, state queries, and more.
articles.author: ShopTalk Show podcast

articles.title: Reveal.js 5.0: The HTML Presentation Framework
articles.description: A long-standing way to build presentations using standard Web technologies (the homepage is, itself, such a presentation) but that, as of version 5, can now create more typical, vertically scrolling Web page experiences too ‚Äì check out this example.
articles.author: Hakim El Hattab

articles.title: Color Contrast Checker: Check Different Combinations Against WCAG Standards
articles.description: An interactive tool where you can adjust hue, saturation, and lightness on background and foreground color selections, and use the sliders to find ‚Äúpassing‚Äù values.
articles.author: Alex Clapperton

articles.title: Linkinator 6.0: A Tool to Find a Site's Broken Links
articles.description: Both a Node.js API and CLI tool that can be used to crawl a site and validate links. You can run it as easily as npx linkinator https://example.com/ right now if you want to try it out.
articles.author: Justin Beckwith

articles.title: A11y - Focus Order: A Figma Plugin to Add Accessibility Annotations
articles.description: Useful for handing off a design to engineers who can then more easily decipher the focus order of the interactive elements in the layout.
articles.author: Microsoft

articles.title: AutoDraw: An Online Drawing Tool That Guesses What You're Trying to Draw
articles.description: Includes standard drawing tools (pen, type, shape, etc.) but also an AutoDraw pen tool that adds a ‚ÄúDo you mean‚Äù panel where you can select from existing drawings that resemble yours.
articles.author: AutoDraw

articles.title: HTML Bundler Plugin for Webpack
articles.description: A plugin that renders HTML templates with referenced source files of styles, scripts, and images. Renders Eta, EJS, Handlebars, and Nunjucks templates "out of the box".
articles.author: webdiscus
